result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:00 PM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Kirk James Walczak.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews the court record, and reviews the Justice Point violation report.  Attny Pollak makes statement regarding violation report.    Court has discussion with DEF.  Court orders Justice Point take DEF on as a client.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt (special appearance). Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Gross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court informs DEF on pending change of attorney, resets STC for 5/10/22 at 11AM.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:29 AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Christian J Ness, appearing by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case (22CF67, 33CM25) and recites appearances.  State indicates Information filed that mirrors complaint, not yet received into case.  Atty Ness has no objection to proceeding if INFO mirrors complaint, enters NG plea on behalf of  DEF.  Court enters NG plea.  Atty Ness requests to be heard on bond modification motion in 22CF67.  State has no objection.  Atty Ness argues for bond modification in 22CF67.  State opposes modifying bond.  Atty Ness makes additional statement, State responds.  Court denies bond modification motion.  Court sets STC for 4/26/22 at 11AM.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Bail/bond hearing on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:16 AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by video.  Defendant Kirk James Walczak in custody appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court indicates case needs ajourned initial appearance,  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.   Attny Ness indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Detective Poplin, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    8:19 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   8:21 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Ness.    Attny Ness no further questions.  8:22 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Ness no arguement.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Ness indicates to file motion for modiciation of bond.    State indicates will hear today.   Attny Ness prefers to place on calendar.   Court sets.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:32 AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak (special appearance).  Defendant Kirk James Walczak in custody appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court continues- initial appearance on Count 2 for  entry of plea to Count 2    Through Counsel request preliminary hearing within time limits.  Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
